Privacy Policy

Effective Date: January 1, 2025
Last Updated: January 1, 2025

At Insurance Fraud Prevention System (IFPS), we are committed to protecting your privacy. This policy explains how we collect, use, store, and protect your data while ensuring our platform functions effectively to detect and prevent insurance fraud.

1. Information We Collect

We collect the following types of information:

a. Personal Information:

  • Full name, date of birth, address, contact details
  • Government-issued identification (ID/passport)
  • Biometric data (e.g., facial recognition)
  • Relationship documents (e.g., birth/marriage certificates)

b. System-Generated Data:

  • Risk scores and fraud flags generated by our AI engines
  • Activity logs, device information, and IP addresses
  • Consent confirmations and notification receipts

c. Third-Party Data:

  • Verification results from Home Affairs
  • Criminal history and watchlist data from law enforcement databases

2. How We Use Your Information

  • Verify identity and policyholder/beneficiary relationships
  • Authenticate consent through multi-factor and biometric checks
  • Analyze behavior for fraud risk detection
  • Prevent, detect, and report suspected fraud
  • Assist law enforcement and regulatory investigations
  • Improve our fraud detection algorithms and user experience

3. Data Sharing

Your information may be shared with:

  • Law enforcement and regulatory bodies during investigations
  • Insurance companies and internal departments involved in fraud review

We do not sell your data to third parties.

4. Data Retention

We retain data for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in this policy or as required by law (e.g., for ongoing investigations).

5. Security Measures

  • End-to-end encryption
  • Biometric verification
  • Role-based access controls
  • Real-time monitoring and alerts

6. Your Rights

Depending on your location, you may have rights to:

  • Access your data
  • Request correction or deletion
  • Object to certain processing activities
  • Lodge a complaint with a regulatory authority

To exercise your rights, contact: privacy@ifpsystem.org

7. Changes to This Policy

We may update this Privacy Policy periodically. You will be notified of significant changes through your registered email or system notifications.
